tweets.html:
Future of news: I'm sitting in St Louis glued to Twitter to see what's up in Ferguson. It's not on a single TV station.

— Eric Garland (@ericgarland) August 13, 2014

"If you wanted to see what the 60's looked like, your watching it" - My Grandma as she watches this unfold #Ferguson

— TyreeBP (@TyreeBP) August 13, 2014

A cop in SWAT gear braying YOUR RIGHT TO ASSEMBLE IS NOT BEING VIOLATED from atop a tank is ludicrous in a way Terry Gilliam couldn't touch.

— Bo Bolander (@BBolander) August 14, 2014

They're singing "Praise Is What I Do" on the Livestream. I'm giggling and also really moved, lol. A Wednesday night church service w tanks.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) August 14, 2014

Maybe if we tipoff @CNN that the Malaysian Airlines plane was found in Ferguson, they'll actually cover what's going on there.

— Robert McCann (@mccannr1) August 14, 2014

now imagine there's no twitter and the police chief didn't find it mildly embarrassing that you were arrested because you were a journalist

— Matt Novak (@paleofuture) August 14, 2014

White men pointing guns at cops? Patriots. Black men pointing cameras? Criminals. #BundyRanch #Ferguson pic.twitter.com/yRFucRrsK0

— Ryan J. Downey (@ryandowney) August 14, 2014

The next time someone tells you social media is useless remember what's on the major news networks right now.

— Mark Primiano (@BPSS_UGod) August 14, 2014

Idea: Get a Kardashian to stand in front of protesters. Guaranteed media coverage & either way the situation goes, the world wins. #Ferguson

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) August 14, 2014

Right now--RIGHT FUCKING NOW--@FoxNews has a panel of pundits discussing diaper-changing etiquette. #Ferguson #Denialism

— Ted Genoways (@TedGenoways) August 14, 2014

"We're dealing with 4,000 animals in there, & you want to give me attitude?" The deputy yelled, mad I was taking a pic #Ferguson #MikeBrown

— Eli Rosenberg (@EliNBCBoston) August 14, 2014

Reading about #Ferguson, I find it ironic that the current situation was perfectly summed up by a TV show. pic.twitter.com/3nUhBgZNLF

— Harvey Gold (@UTCrimDefROX) August 14, 2014

If you're a man wearing armor, holding a gun beside a tank, telling people not to record what is about to happen, you might be the bad guy.

— Happy Holidays Cook (@Cameronbcook) August 14, 2014

Only people I‚Äôm more worried about than folks on the ground in #Ferguson are folks depending on cable news to find out what‚Äôs going on.

— Saeed Jones (@theferocity) August 14, 2014

When police and government demand that you stop recording, they know they are doing wrong. #Ferguson

— Dan Bernstein (@dan_bernstein) August 14, 2014

MSNBC: Police are tear gassing protesters.

FOX: Police are taking action against an unruly crowd.

CNN: Seriously, where is that plane?

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) August 14, 2014

Michael McDonald is from #Ferguson! -- if "E!" is looking for an angle on this story

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) August 14, 2014

Don't mean to distract anyone from Shark Week, but it's terrifying that no one can see #Ferguson right now

— Mdub (@lineofmargarets) August 14, 2014

tweets.author_name: Beyonce has an uncle named Larry Beyince. Bruh....
tweets.html:
FOX News gotta be sick. As much as they wanna kill Obama for sitting on his hands, to do that they'd have to imply that black lives manner

— Beyonce has an uncle named Larry Beyince. Bruh.... (@DragonflyJonez) August 14, 2014

Our liberty cannot be guarded but by the freedom of the press, nor that be limited without danger of losing it. - Thomas Jefferson

— Jeanna (@jeannathomas) August 14, 2014

Officer literally just asked me if I want to get shot (for taking a photo of all things...) No thanks for asking, I'll pass. #Ferguson

— Alice Speri (@alicesperi) August 14, 2014

JESUS FUCKING CHRIST: To hell w/ #Ferguson, CNN is running a segment that starts w/ an anchorMuppet asking "Is suicide contagious?" #Werther

— Anthony Crupi (@crupicrupicrupi) August 14, 2014

Welp. Guess MSNBC is the only TV network covering this. CNN is like..."were done here" #Ferguson

— Black Girl Nerds (@BlackGirlNerds) August 14, 2014

Some idiot is gonna write the dumbest article ever tomorrow and make everyone even madder so at least we can look forward to that

— Dan Hopper (@DanHopp) August 14, 2014

Someone, quickly deploy buckets of ice water for dumping over heads to #Ferguson protestors so that maybe the media will pay attention.

— itsonlyzach (@itsonlyzach) August 14, 2014

Mike Brown was killed over 100 hours ago and we still don't know the name of the officer who shot him.

— Mike Hayes (@michaelhayes) August 14, 2014

I know it‚Äôs late, but we‚Äôre having a heckuva time getting statewide Missouri officials to talk to us tonight about what‚Äôs happening there.

— Rachel Maddow MSNBC (@maddow) August 14, 2014

Any update on that readout? @Schultz44 Readout of tonight's social gathering coming shortly - spoiler alert: a good time was had by all.

— Zack Parsons (@sexyfacts4u) August 14, 2014

In 50 years, our grandchildren will read about #Ferguson like we read about Selma.

— Awesomely Luvvie (@Luvvie) August 14, 2014

If the Ferguson officers were justified in their actions, they wouldn't have enacted a media blackout. The end.

— Mark Waid (@MarkWaid) August 14, 2014

I just GASPED when I read this total bullshit. WE ARE WATCHING AND YOU ARE LYING. #Ferguson https://t.co/K9OgRginsU

— Jessica Luther (@scATX) August 14, 2014

The worst part of all of this is that we will never find out what Aaron Sorkin's take is

— Emily Yoshida (@emilyyoshida) August 14, 2014

To save the humanities we need multiple tanks?

— Save the Humanities (@SaveHumanities) August 14, 2014

The images on the news don't really show the side street in #Ferguson. There are huge clouds of tear gas and people are hemmed in here.

— jelani cobb (@jelani9) August 14, 2014

Having to constantly remind myself that not everyone has their eyes glued to a Twitter feed right now. Some aren't seeing this. #Ferguson

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) August 14, 2014

Does the ‚ÄúC‚Äù in ‚ÄúMSNBC‚Äù stand for ‚ÄúCialis‚Äù? I feel like this network has gone all-in on boner pills.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) August 14, 2014

White people with guns "protest." Black people with their hands in the air "riot." Keep it straight, people.

— John Rogers (@jonrog1) August 14, 2014

Remember: whatever happens, tomorrow morning the corporations who made all these high-tech maim-and-kill toys will still be making bank.

— Saladin Ahmed (@saladinahmed) August 14, 2014

While MSNBC covers Ferguson, Fox News Channel encores O'Reilly; he's shilling T-shirts & mugs & self-fellating re his tactful RW commentary.

— Anthony Crupi (@crupicrupicrupi) August 14, 2014

Called #Ferguson PD to ask abt @AntonioFrench arrest. Told me they can't confirm, told me to "get it on the web." "We're very busy."

— Amanda Terkel (@aterkel) August 14, 2014

It's amazing how CNN can go for three weeks on an airplane going down, but give them a legit civil rights crisis and it's NOPENOPENOPE.gif

— Cassandra (@ChrisWarcraft) August 14, 2014

My feed right now is a mix of devastating Ferguson news, cast members live tweeting a random MTV show, and people throwing ice on their head

— (((Andrew Rabin)))üìé (@arrabin56) August 14, 2014

I‚Äôm sorry- the Ferguson news, the MTV tweets, the ice water, and A NATE SILVER STORY ABOUT A BURRITO. Well played, Hardwick.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))üìé (@arrabin56) August 14, 2014

nate silver seems like a cool dude with a good grasp on timing

— pilot (@pilotbacon) August 14, 2014

"I want to make sure everyone knows these guys were cool. So let's upgrade it from "chill" to "SUPER chill." https://t.co/K8QaGOKBY6

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) August 14, 2014

#NotAllBurritos

— Ryan Maino (@PARecSpecs) August 14, 2014

So my twitter feed just stopped talking about Ferguson and has only been about Nate Silver for the last 15 minutes...

— Person of Mattress (@digifreak642) August 14, 2014

i‚Äôm imagining a person drowning and nate silver walking up to them to tell a story about when he drank a cup of water too fast

— pilot (@pilotbacon) August 14, 2014

Nate Silver introducing some levity by playing up his beloved character, "Guy who can understand numbers...but not the world around him"

— Muffin MacGuffinüïØ (@MuffMacGuff) August 14, 2014

nate silver: [sees cops shooting and gassing people] this reminds me of a burrito i had

— jon hendren (@fart) August 14, 2014

[Nate Silver views FOIA'd footage of Gitmo detainee being waterboarded] oh man one time I drank a glass of water too fast and hiccuped

— Xeni Jardin ü§Ø (@xeni) August 14, 2014

Really harrowing @NateSilver538 arrest story on timeline. Crazy that it happened in America. #Ferguson

— #JeSuisRoyMoore (@ProfJeffJarviss) August 14, 2014

538 is police code for "officer buying burrito for man who will one day insufferably bring it up at the worst possible time"

— üçç doogal rememberer üçç (@crushingbort) August 14, 2014

This is why Rachel Maddow is my only white lady crush. You see her always constructing arguments WITH THESES? I'm saying.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) August 14, 2014

OMG. Police Chief in #Ferguson blamed "Outside Agitators." Historians of the South issue collective groan of recognition.

— Cynthia Lynn Lyerly (@LynnLyerly) August 14, 2014

Yep, #Ferguson police chief, you definitely want to invoke George Wallace into your argument. #OutsideAgitators

— Holly Jolly Christmas (@hollye83) August 14, 2014

Vicious, snarling police state, despised everywhere besides television, where it is relentlessly rationalized.

— James Adomian (@JAdomian) August 14, 2014

Somewhere in Hollywood, the producers of ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs Be Cops‚Äù (in theaters now!) are cursing and chucking blunt objects at their TVs.

— Dave Weigel (@daveweigel) August 14, 2014

um...er...lets be cops?

— billy eichner (@billyeichner) August 14, 2014

Al Jazeera TV crew scrambles for cover as police fire tear gas into their reporting position in #Ferguson | AP Photo pic.twitter.com/FIy6qMtHiZ

— Brandon Wall (@Walldo) August 14, 2014

PHOTOS: Police fire tear gas near Al Jazeera crew, then disassemble the gear after they flee. #Ferguson pic.twitter.com/It5FOxVWhB

— Cassidy Moody (@CassFM) August 14, 2014

One thing about giving your cops military-style gear: it certainly makes for interesting photos of your community, distributed worldwide.

— Steve Inskeep (@NPRinskeep) August 14, 2014

Sign of the times: I got up wondering what happened in Ferguson overnight, & never thought about checking a news site rather than Twitter.

— Cheryl B. Klein (@chavelaque) August 14, 2014
